summary: The Innovate to Save Lives Act amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a tax credit to small businesses for research activities related to mitigating certain drug threats. This includes research on emerging drugs, fentanyl, fentanyl-related substances, and methamphetamine. The bill defines these terms and specifies the types of research eligible for the credit. A GAO report will be produced 5 years after enactment to assess the impact of the credits.
